sources.data_found: Voyager cluster: 3000 core, 24 GPU cluster acquired with funding from an NSF grant. The facility is open to all faculty and staff from Alabama research universities.

UAH HPC system will consist of three to four racks densely packed with individual servers called nodes. Each node will have 64-128 central processing unit cores, for a total of about 3,000 cores for the entire system. NSF grant of $972,261 from NSF's Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research (EPSCoR).

In 2023, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at University of Alabama in Huntsville were Registered Nursing (176 degrees awarded), General Computer & Information Sciences (168 degrees), and Mechanical Engineering (127 degrees). Total enrollment: 8,743 students (6,851 undergraduate and 1,892 graduate students).
Computer Science Department: 132 Total Graduate Students, 45% International Breakout, Male (79%) Female (20%). 219 Applied, 161 Accepted, 37 Enrolled.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count estimated from datausa.io reporting 168 CS bachelor degrees awarded in 2023. Assuming 4-year program and steady enrollment: 168 degrees × 4 years = 672 undergraduates. Graduate count of 132 from Peterson's data. PhD count estimated at 1/3 of graduate students based on typical CS program distribution (44 students). Total CS enrollment estimated at 848 students.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Voyager cluster has 24 GPUs total, but specific models not disclosed in available sources. System acquired via NSF EPSCoR grant for ~$972,261.

gpu_resources.notes: UAH operates the Voyager cluster with 3,000 CPU cores and 24 GPUs as a regional computing center for Alabama universities. Specific GPU models and VRAM capacities were not found in any accessible documentation. The system was funded by an NSF grant and serves a consortium of 10 Alabama universities. Without access to detailed technical specifications or user documentation, GPU model information remains unavailable.

analysis_notes: Data collection revealed Voyager cluster specifications (24 GPUs total) but no model details. CS enrollment estimated from degree completion data: 168 CS bachelor degrees awarded annually suggests ~672 undergraduates (4-year program). Graduate CS enrollment of 132 confirmed via Peterson's. PhD count estimated as typical proportion of graduate students.
